    Provides text editing functionality

      static java.lang.String editRegion(java.lang.String s, int startIndex, int endIndex, java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> function)
      Applys a function to the specified region of the string
      Example: String s = "Eine Geschichte"; s = editRegion(s, "Eine ", "Geschichte", (str) -> { return str += "spannende "; System.out.println(s); //Eine spannende Geschichte });
      static java.lang.String editRegion(java.lang.String s, java.lang.String regionStart, java.lang.String regionEnd, java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> function)
      Applys a function to the specified region of the string
      The region is defined by the end of "regionStart" and the beginning of "regionEnd"

        public static java.lang.String insertBetweenLines(java.lang.String s,
                                                  java.lang.String containsLineBefore,
                                                  java.lang.String containsLineAfter,
                                                  java.lang.String insert)
        Inserts "insert" between the first line that contains "containsLineBefore" and the first line after that, which contains "containsLineAfter". It also automatically adds a new line.

        containsLineAfter -
        insert -

      • intelligentIndexSearch

        public static int intelligentIndexSearch(java.lang.String s,
                                         TextEditor.TextSearchQueue... search)
        Returns the index in String s to which the following applies:
      • Every text of every TextSearchQueue-Object in the search-array is found in s.
      • Every text of every TextSearchQueue-Object is in range to the last TextSearchQueue-Object with its given search-radius
      • Every text of every TextSearchQueue-Object is at minimum its distance away from the last TextSearchQueue-Object

Parameters:
s -
search -
Returns:
